document_data.caption: ''A pair of [[Cormyr]]ean Worn Whispers''
document_data.name: ''Worn Whispers''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Worn Whispers''''' were a specific variety of ''[[boots of stealth]]'' that originated from the kingdom of [[Cormyr]].
document_data.Powers: These boots allowed the wearer to move more silently and hide with greater ease.
document_data.History:
These boots were worn by the royal spies of [[Rhigaerd Obarskyr II|King Rhigaerd II]], who ruled Cormyr during the late 13{{th}} and early 14{{th}} centuries [[DR]].The item description given in ''[[Baldur's Gate (game)|Baldur's Gate]]'' doesn't specify whether the king in question was [[Rhiigard Obarskyr]] (sometimes spelled "Rhiegard") or [[Rhigaerd Obarskyr II]]. Due to the inconsistent spelling of Rhiigard, this article assumes Rhigaerd II had the boots commissioned. The spies were renowned throughout the kingdom and beyond for their tremendous skill in their craft. Eventually the order of spies were betrayed from within, and the tools of their trade, including numerous pairs of these boots were dispersed across the Realms.

One such pair of magic boots was worn by [[Purvis]], the assassin who was hired by the speaker of [[Lonelywood]] in the {{YearlinkName|1281}}.

One set of ''worn whispers'' came into the possession of the [[thief]] [[Zhurlong]] sometime before the [[1368 DR|Year of the Banner, 1368 DR]]. He then proceeded to lose them to some [[hobgoblin]]s just south of [[Beregost]].

Another pair had been recovered by one of the guildmasters of the [[Shadow Thieves]], [[Mae'Var]] of [[Athkatla]].


Yet another pair were claimed by [[Samuel Thunderburp]] a bartender who also resided within Athkatla.
